alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Columbia, southeastern Lincoln, Edgefield, northwestern Aiken and southeastern McCormick Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 800 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near J. Strom Thurmond Dam, or 9 miles northwest of Evans, moving northeast at 55 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Evans, Martinez, Edgefield, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Edgefield County Airport, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Riverwood, Mistletoe State Park, Hamilton Branch State Park, Trenton, Parksville, Strom Thurmond High School, Modoc, Scott`s Landing, Wildwood Park, Cleora, Modoc Boat Ramp, Colliers, Eubank-Blanchard Community Center and Bussey Point Campground. This includes Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 187 and 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
